channel.title: Just got 360
channel.description: I know i'm like a billion years late on getting one :confused: I heard alot of them getting over heating and they go boom boom, any suggestions to keep that under controll?

item.title: Just got 360
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

eczema3:

The PS3 just gets super hot, theres video on youtube of people frying steaks etc. on thier PS3.

Those are not PS3s. Those are grills shaped like PS3s.

Read full topic

item.title: Just got 360
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

They did have a problem originally, there were reports from Microsoft employees that they found the problems in testing but decided the release it anyway to make sure they got that year headstart on the PS3.

It is mostly gone from the newer models, but that new E74 error that started popping up more and more after the NXE became a problem to the point where microsoft could no longer ignore it, so they put that under the 3 year warranty too.

Read full topic

item.title: Just got 360
item.dc:creator: @Andrew Andrew
item.description:
@Andrew wrote:

ive had mine for 3 years… never had one problem, I dont know what people do to get theirs fucked up. Just dont put it on top of something like a cable box, and make sure there’s consistent air flow

Read full topic

item.title: Just got 360
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:15, topic:290990”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=384692.msg2889586#msg2889586 date=1248814326]
The PS3 just gets super hot, theres video on youtube of people frying steaks etc. on thier PS3.
[/quote]
theres a video of someone opening a fryed 360 and cooking an egg on the heatsink[/quote]That’s not bad. Not sure why everyone freaked about that. You could cook an egg on any heatsink in your computer, if you’ve got a modern computer with some powerful components and only fan cooling.

Read full topic

item.title: Just got 360
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

the bank:

The RRoD is a thing of the past, and only kept alive by PS3 and Wii fanboys, like yourself

Much like how 360 fanboys are exaggerating release PS3’s “yellow light of death”.

Do microsoft still do the free 3 year cover for rrod/e-74?

Read full topic

item.title: Just got 360
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“Tico, post:10, topic:290990”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=384692.msg2889117#msg2889117 date=1248796162]
If you didn’t want your console to break, you shouldn’t have gotten a 360 and instead gotten a PS3, Wii, or gaming computer. But since you already got a 360, all you can do is cross your fingers and hope nothing happens, though it probably will.
[/quote]

He’s covered for a year by Microsoft anyway; not to mention any warranty he may’ve purchased from the store. Even as the bank said, the newer generation 360’s don’t get errors and such as easily.

What games did you get with it?[/quote]

iirc, Microsoft extended the warranty to 3 years because they knew about the previous failure rates. It was basically a sign that even Microsoft thought the 360 was made poorly.

Read full topic

item.title: Just got 360
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

If you didn’t want your console to break, you shouldn’t have gotten a 360 and instead gotten a PS3, Wii, or gaming computer. But since you already got a 360, all you can do is cross your fingers and hope nothing happens, though it probably will.

He’s covered for a year by Microsoft anyway; not to mention any warranty he may’ve purchased from the store. Even as the bank said, the newer generation 360’s don’t get errors and such as easily.

What games did you get with it?

Read full topic

item.title: Just got 360
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:8, topic:290990”]If you didn’t want your console to break, you shouldn’t have gotten a 360 and instead gotten a PS3, Wii, or gaming computer. But since you already got a 360, all you can do is cross your fingers and hope nothing happens, though it probably will.[/quote]Incorrect. Since he just got it, he got the new gen, which only RRoD’s when dropped etc. The problem with the last gen with over heating etc was caused by too much voltage being channeled through the circuits, melting the soldering. The new gen has fixed this problem.

The RRoD is a thing of the past, and only kept alive by PS3 and Wii fanboys, like yourself

Read full topic

item.title: Just got 360
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If you didn’t want your console to break, you shouldn’t have gotten a 360 and instead gotten a PS3, Wii, or gaming computer. But since you already got a 360, all you can do is cross your fingers and hope nothing happens, though it probably will.

Read full topic

item.title: Just got 360
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:6, topic:290990”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=384692.msg2885930#msg2885930 date=1248611354]

[quote author=Speljohan link=topic=384692.msg2885878#msg2885878 date=1248608595]

I wouldn’t bother with what sanga says, if something goes wrong you won’t get your warranty.
[/quote]Unless you do what i buy and get a pre-chipped xbox from a store/service

did you get yours with thermal paste or an extra fan?
[/quote]No, funny thing is that it rroded when i woke up today, but i restarted it and it works again :P[/quote]

Thats luck lol. I had e74 error, and it was 119 bucks to fix

Read full topic

item.title: Just got 360
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

open the thing up, scrape their shitty excuse for thermal paste away and apply your own and do it properly they do it like 5 year olds finger painting. You can also add another internal fan that would keep it a bit cooler

Read full topic
